definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: That, says the Lancet, was a shocking failure.
sentences.chinese: 《柳叶刀》认为，这是一个令人震惊的失败。

sentences.english: The findings are published on Thursday in an online edition of The Lancet medical journal.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究报告刊登在周四的柳叶刀医学杂志在线版上。

sentences.english: The report is published online Sept. 30 in The Lancet.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告等于九月三十日的《柳叶刀》在线。

sentences.english: The doctor lanced the boil on his hand.
sentences.chinese: 医生用柳叶刀切开他手上的水泡。

sentences.english: He was not linked to the study and co-authored a commentary in the Lancet.
sentences.chinese: 他没有联系的研究和柳叶刀在共同撰写的一篇评论。

sentences.english: The report appears in the September issue of The Lancet Oncology.
sentences.chinese: 报告刊登在柳叶刀肿瘤学9月号上。

sentences.english: The findings are published online in the Journal Lancet.
sentences.chinese: 这些研究结果发表在医学期刊《柳叶刀》上。

sentences.english: Leeches and lances might seem like prescriptions from the past.
sentences.chinese: 水蛭和柳叶刀似乎是过去的处方。

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1

definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
World Health Organization (WHO)/abbr. for 世界衛生組織|世界卫生组织[Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1]
